Author: Leo Tolstoy,  Anna Karenina
Quote: I think... if it is true that there are as many minds as there are heads, then there are as many kinds of love as there are hearts.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet.

Author: Frank McCourt,  Angela's Ashes
Quote: You might be poor, your shoes might be broken, but your mind is a palace.

Author: Milan Kundera,  The Unbearable Lightness of Being
Quote: When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  M Is for Magic
Quote: Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit.

Author: Terry Pratchett
Quote: I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it.

Author: Plutarch
Quote: The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled.

Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.,  Autocrat of the Breakfast Table
Quote: A man's mind is stretched by a new idea or sensation, and never shrinks back to its former dimensions.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: I must have a prodigious amount of mind; it takes me as much as a week, sometimes, to make it up!

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre

Author: Cornelia Funke,  Inkheart

Author: Joseph Addison
Quote: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Self-Reliance
Quote: Nothing is at last sacred but the integrity of your own mind.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: People tend to be generous when sharing their nonsense, fear, and ignorance. And while they seem quite eager to feed you their negativity, please remember that sometimes the diet we need to be on is a spiritual and emotional one. Be cautious with what you feed your mind and soul. Fuel yourself with positivity and let that fuel propel you into positive action.

Author: George Orwell,  1984
Quote: Reality exists in the human mind, and nowhere else.

Author: George Harrison
Quote: It's all in the mind.

Author: Dumas Malone,  Jefferson the Virginian
Quote: The boldness of his mind was sheathed in a scabbard of politeness.

Author: Patricia Briggs,  Dragon Blood
Quote: A man says a lot of things in summer he doesn't mean in winter.

Author: Stephen King
Quote: The mind can calculate, but the spirit yearns, and the heart knows what the heart knows

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations

Author: Aristotle,  The Philosophy of Aristotle
Quote: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.

Author: Hanh Nhat Thich
Quote: The mind can go in a thousand directions, but on this beautiful path, I walk in peace. With each step, the wind blows. With each step, a flower blooms.

Author: Vladimir Nabokov

Author: Rabindranath Tagore
Quote: Most people believe the mind to be a mirror, more or less accurately reflecting the world outside them, not realizing on the contrary that the mind is itself the principal element of creation.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  Complete Tales & Poems
Quote: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night. In their gray visions they obtain glimpses of eternity, and thrill, in waking, to find that they have been upon the verge of the great secret. In snatches, they learn something of the wisdom which is of good, and more of the mere knowledge which is of evil.

Author: Seneca,  The Stoic Philosophy of Seneca: Essays and Letters
Quote: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.

Author: Jennifer Niven,  All the Bright Places

Quote: A man's mind may be likened to a garden, which may be intelligently cultivated or allowed to run wild; but whether cultivated or neglected, it must, and will, bring forth. Author: Geraldine Brooks,  March

Author: V. Vale,  Modern Primitives: An Investigation of Contemporary Adornment and Ritual

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday

Author: Eckhart Tolle,  Practicing the Power of Now: Essential Teachings, Meditations, and Exercises from the Power of Now

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
Quote: To understand the immeasurable, the mind must be extraordinarily quiet, still.

Author: Bernard Malamud,  The Fixer
Quote: Where to look if you've lost your mind?

Author: Joseph Conrad,  Heart of Darkness
Quote: The mind of man is capable of anything.

Author: Black Elk
Quote: The first peace, which is the most important, is that which comes within the souls of people when they realize their relationship, their oneness with the universe and all its powers, and when they realize at the center of the universe dwells the Great Spirit, and that its center is really everywhere, it is within each of us.

Author: John Ortberg Jr.,  The Me I Want to Be: Becoming God's Best Version of You
Quote: Never worry alone. When anxiety grabs my mind, it is self-perpetuating. Worrisome thoughts reproduce faster than rabbits, so one of the most powerful ways to stop the spiral of worry is simply to disclose my worry to a friend... The simple act of reassurance from another human being [becomes] a tool of the Spirit to cast out fear -- because peace and fear are both contagious.

Author: نجيب محفوظ,  الحب تحت المطر
Quote: القلب يعرف أكثر مما يتصور العقل

Quote: Pity me that the heart is slow to learnWhat the swift mind beholds at every turn.

Author: Anne Brontë,  Agnes Grey
Quote: It is foolish to wish for beauty. Sensible people never either desire it for themselves or care about it in others. If the mind be but well cultivated, and the heart well disposed, no one ever cares for the exterior.

Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
Quote: The face is a picture of the mind with the eyes as its interpreter.

Author: Ludwig Wittgenstein,  Culture and Value
Quote: A man will be imprisoned in a room with a door that's unlocked and opens inwards; as long as it does not occur to him to pull rather than push.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Everything that is really great and inspiring is created by the individual who can labor in freedom.

Author: Sara Gruen,  Water for Elephants
Quote: Even as your body betrays you, your mind denies it.

Author: Giovanni Boccaccio
Quote: You must read, you must persevere, you must sit up nights, you must inquire, and exert the utmost power of your mind. If one way does not lead to the desired meaning, take another; if obstacles arise, then still another; until, if your strength holds out, you will find that clear which at first looked dark.

Author: Charlotte Eriksson
Quote: I haven’t been very impressed lately.By people,or places,or the way someone said he loved me and then slowly changed his mind.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Hard-Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World

Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.,  Autocrat of the Breakfast Table
Quote: Insanity is often the logic of an accurate mind overtasked

Author: Charles Dickens,  David Copperfield

Author: Robert Greene

Author: Shannon L. Alder

Author: Criss Jami,  Diotima, Battery, Electric Personality

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
